text: Kenneth Porter Gatchell (September 3, 1901 - June 29, 1972) was a college basketball player and coach. He was twice an All-Southern guard for the Mississippi Aggies, leading them to the 1923 SoCon Tournament title. He was also a center on the football team, and All-American in the discus. He later coached basketball at his alma mater, posting a 14-9 record. He was inducted into the Mississippi Sports Hall of Fame in 1966. He was 6'2" 200 pounds. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1901 births Category:1972 deaths Category:American football centers Category:Basketball coaches from Illinois Category:Basketball coaches from Mississippi Category:Basketball players from Illinois Category:Basketball players from Mississippi Category:Discus throwers Category:Guards (basketball) Category:Mississippi State Bulldogs football players Category:Mississippi State Bulldogs men's basketball coaches Category:Mississippi State Bulldogs men's basketball players Category:Ole Miss Rebels men's basketball coaches Category:People from Clinton, Illinois Category:People from Moorhead, Mississippi
title: K. P. Gatchell
